Summer updates

 posted on 25 Aug 2021

I worked on creating and implementing a new algorithm for using information theory to make phylogenetic trees from aligned DNA sequences at the Cummings Lab in UMD.

This project motivated many interesting biological questions, but here is a mathematical one that caught my fancy: Given a function , can one find a polynomial time algorithm to compute the global maximum of ? One might be tempted to say “ah this is just integer programming” but what happens when there is no meaningful extension of to ? This problem arises in computing the optimal split in a tree, where we must maximize the function over all possible partitions of a finite set . Here is the (empirical) entropy of . Email me if you have suggestions and find out more about this project here.

New Projects!

 posted on 5 Jun 2021

The initial commit of projects is in (hopefully with many more to come). Particular highlights include my undergraduate thesis, code for a couple of projects, and a stash of notes meant for the cramming undergraduate (aka me 2 years ago). Check them out here.

Website is up!

 posted on 5 Jun 2021

Finally the website is up! It looks a bit minimal, but that’s kind of the style I meant to go for. I used this template designed by Marc Weitz to start with. The wonders of open source never cease to amaze.
